docs.title: Free Iran -- open internet access for the people
docs.text:
This guide provides instructions to evade local internet restrictions, using covert proxy server infrastructure.

Follow the appropriate guide for the device(s) you utilize by navigating the menu on this site.

Infrastructure employs nginx websocket proxying with v2ray-core over the vmess protocol.

docs.title: Advanced Users
docs.text:
Advanced users can utilise the below information to configure their application of choice on their devices.

Configuration profiles exist for two available proxy services:

  • Free Iran
  • Power Vmess

Choose the desired service or feel free to import configuration for both services, for redundancy.

docs.text:
Clipboard

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard

Free IranPower Vmess 
vmess:

vmess:

docs.title: Client Config QR Code:
docs.text: Free IranPower Vmess

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: 1. Download V2rayNG from the Google Play store.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Copy the below URI to clipboard for the respective proxy service you are configuring:

Clipboard

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard

Free IranPower Vmess 
vmess:

vmess:

2. Run the V2rayNG app

3. On the Configuration screen, click the + icon to add a server

4. Select Import config from clipboard

Success

Successful import confirmation should be displayed

5. Click on the connect button to connect the VPN

6. For the first time only, approve the first use connection request

7. Enjoy the internet!

Test Connection

To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Disconnection
docs.text: To disconnect from the service, open V2rayNG and from the main screen, click on the connect/disconnect icon to disconnect:

docs.title: Check Connection
docs.text:
To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Clock Synchronization
docs.text: Cryptographic negotiation requires client devices to have their clocks synchronized with an accurate time source. If connections fail, please ensure your device clock & date is set correctly.

docs.title: Alternate Clients
docs.text:
The following is a list of known alternate clients, for different operating systems.

Client Operating System Link Comments OneClick iOS Setup Guide Can be unreliable. Submitted report to developer Shadowrocket iOS App Store Reliable, but a paid iOS application Shadowsocks Android Google Play Untested

docs.title: Bypass Paywalls
docs.text:
Many popular international news websites hide premium content behind "pay walls", requiring paid subscriptions to read articles.

A free browser extension for Chrome, Edge, and Firefox can be used to automatically remove these paywall blocks.

Details, including browser extension installation instructions, can be viewed at the Bypass Paywalls GitHub website.

docs.title: Contact Us
docs.text:
If you still require assistance, feel free to contact us using our private Telegram group.

Service status updates will be posted to the Telegram group as required.

Telegram Invite

docs.title: Setup Guides
docs.text:
The below guides have been written for each common operating system:

Operating System Devices App Guide Windows Windows laptops & desktops V2rayN Android Android phones & tablets V2rayNG iOS iPhones & iPads NapsternetV macOS Macbooks; Mac Studio; iMacs V2RayX

Some alternate clients are noted on the Troubleshooting page.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: 1. Download and run OneClick from the App Store

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Click Add Server

2. Click Scan QR Code, using the below code:

3. Click the connect button

4. Select Allow to allow the VPN Configuration installation

5. Enter your device PIN to confirm VPN configuration

6. Enjoy the internet!

Test Connection

To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Disconnection
docs.text: To disconnect from the service, open OneClick and click on the green connection button:

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: 1. Install NapsternetV from the App Store

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Copy the below URI to clipboard for the respective proxy service you are configuring:

Clipboard

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard

Free IranPower Vmess 
vmess:

vmess:

1. Run the NapsternetV app

2. Read & accept the Privacy Policy

3. Click Add Configuration

4. Click Allow to add the VPN configuration profile to iOS

5. Enter iOS passcode to confirm VPN profile install

6. On the Configs screen, click the + icon in the top-right and select Import v2ray URI from clipboard

7. Click Allow to allow paste of vmess URI from Step #1

Success

Successful configuration import should be shown:

8. After the successful import, click on the Free Iran profile name to select the default configuration profile for connections.

9. Click the Home botton and select the connect icon to connect to VPN

10. Enjoy the internet!

Test Connection

To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Disconnection
docs.text: To disconnect from the service, open OneClick and click on the green connection button:

docs.title: Prerequisite (Homebrew)
docs.text:
1. If you do not already have Homebrew{target=_blank installed on your macOS machine, do so first via typing the below in Terminal:

Terminal

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard 

/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Install V2RayX for macOS by typing the below in Terminal:

Terminal

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard 

brew install v2rayx

2. Run V2rayX

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. In the system Toolbar, click on V2rayX and select Load core

Warning

If this step is not completed each time V2RayX is restarted, the proxy connections will not succeed.

2. Again from the system Toolbar, click on V2RayX and select Configure...

3. Select Support UDP and enter any desired DNS servers, comma delimited.

Note

1.1.1.1 is the IP address of CloudFlare's free & redundant primary public DNS server.

4. Click Import and select Import from other links...

5. Copy the below URI to clipboard for the respective proxhy service you are configuring, and paste the link into V2RayX:

Clipboard

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard

Free IranPower Vmess 
vmess:

vmess:

6. Click OK and then OK again to save the profile

docs.title: Global System Proxy
docs.text:
To enable the proxy system-wide, click on the V2RayX application in the System Toolbar, and select Global Mode:

Note

To disable the Windows-wide proxy, use the same steps but select Manual Mode, or quit the application.

docs.title: Per-Application Proxy
docs.text:
Instead of system-wide use, to enable use of the proxy on a per-application basis (e.g., for a specific web browser), use Manual Mode and in each desired application, manually configure the local machine proxy that V2RayX creates using server 127.0.0.1 and the SOCKS5 or HTTP port shown in V2RayX configuration.

Examples shown below use port 1081 for SOCKS5 and port 8001 for HTTP proxy:

Firefox Example

To configure only the Firefox browser to send traffic via the proxy, apply the relevant settings in the browser Settings -> Proxy Settings:

docs.title: Test Connection
docs.text:
To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Disconnection
docs.text: To disconnect from the service, either quit the application, or select Manual Mode and remove per-application proxy configuration if required (such as Firefox in the previous example).

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Download and extract V2rayN for Windows

2. Run V2rayN.exe

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text:
1. Copy the below URI to clipboard for the respective proxy service you are configuring:

Clipboard

Select icon on right hand side of text to copy to clipboard

Free IranPower Vmess 
vmess:

vmess:

2. From the V2rayN application, select Servers -> Import bulk URL from clipboard:

3. Successful import should be confirmed as per below:

docs.title: Global System Proxy
docs.text:
To enable the proxy system-wide, right-click on the V2rayN application in the System Tray, and select System Proxy -> Set System Proxy:

Note

To disable the Windows-wide proxy, use the same steps but select Clear System Proxy

docs.title: Per-Application Proxy
docs.text:
Instead of system-wide use, to enable use of the proxy on a per-application basis (e.g., for a specific web browser), manually configure the local machine proxy that V2rayN creates using server 127.0.0.1 and the SOCKS5 or HTTP port shown in the bottom of the V2ray application window.

Note

Examples shown below use port 10808 for SOCKS5 and port 10809 for HTTP proxy:

Firefox Example

To configure only the Firefox browser to send traffic via the proxy, apply the relevant settings in the browser Settings -> Proxy Settings:

docs.title: Test Connection
docs.text:
To check if the proxy is properly configured and connected, you can test your connection below.

Warning

Ad Blockers may need to be disabled for this website in order for the test to run and not generate a blank page.

Test Connection

docs.title: Disconnection
docs.text:
To disconnect from the service, select Clear System Proxy from the System Tray before closing the V2RayN application.

Alternatively, if using per-application proxy configuration, remove the configuration from required applications (such as Firefox in the previous example).
